programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Helmets, Tea, District Heating"
programme.desc: How do they harvest and treat the world's most expensive tea? Plus, how does the Siekierki power plant of Warsaw, Poland heat half the city's homes?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Royal Enfield, Art Fraud, Milk"
programme.desc: How do they engineer the latest incarnation of the classic Royal Enfield Continental GT motorbike? Plus, how do 'art detectives' spot a forgery?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Crash Testing, Delftware, Umbrellas"
programme.desc: How do they blend science and destruction at crash test centres? And how do they piece together the complex mechanism of a pocket sized umbrella?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Test Your Science Genius"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. Do flying squirrels really fly? What caused the extinction of the dinosaur? How old are the fossils found at the bottom of the Grand Canyon?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "What’s Your Science IQ?"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. How smart is the modern-day robot? How come Earth has a protective atmosphere? Why does the U.S. have more tornadoes than anywhere else in the world?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Discover your Science Intelligence"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. Is it true that we only use 10% of our brain? Did Mars used to have an ocean? How much longer will we be able to live on fossil fuels?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Measure Your Sci Q"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. What causes a lightning strike? Where in our solar system is the asteroid belt? What’s the difference between a stalagmite and a stalactite?

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Color"
programme.desc: In this episode we'll understand how chromatic adaptation works, how do we see the color pink and why do blue rarely exists in nature.

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Problems"
programme.desc: A lot of problems in this episode. What is the Birthday Problem? Why the Gambler's Ruin debunks the 'luck' factor? And is the union of two sets with infinite elements still be infinity?

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Nature’s games"
programme.desc: In this episode we learn about Carrion flowers, also called stink or corpse flower. The cuckoo hability to misdirect predators to find nests and how some animals released pheromones to comunicate.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Da Vinci Chariot"
programme.desc: Today we have Leonardo Da Vinci's invention again. Could this death chariot change warfare?

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "4 Armed Catapult"
programme.desc: The 13th century catapult must be great, especially when it has 4 spinning arms.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Roman Crane"
programme.desc: The crane that gave us the Pantheon, the Coliseum and Hadrian's Wall gives the Re-Inventors a history lesson.

programme.title: The Re-Inventors S2 - "Chinese Rockets"
programme.desc: Rebuilding a 700-year-old multi-stage weapon brings multiple problems to Matt and Jeremy.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Landing on Mars"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli looks at the varied and ingenious methods used to land spacecraft on the red planet, starting with Pathfinder in 1997.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "A Year of Space Odyssey"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli explores the amazing journeys of spacecraft that gathered spectacular images of Mercury, Jupiter and Mars.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Surviving in Deep Space"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli looks at how surviving in deep space can become a reality.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S4 - "Spectacular Space Views"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli looks at the incredible phenomena of our universe, and our own planet’s turbulent atmosphere.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "The Future Of Water"
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell explores how drought stricken southern California is using millions of plastic balls to conserve water.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "The Robot Revolution"
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell gets introduced to a 200 pound robot that’s almost as graceful as a dancer.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "The Future Of Robot Makers And Innovators"
programme.sub-title: The Future Of Robot Makers And Innovators
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell also pays a visit to a shop that builds customized robots.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "The Animal Kingdom Meets Future Tech"
programme.sub-title: The Animal Kingdom Meets Future Tech
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell goes to abandoned areas of Detroit where dog lovers are tracking thousands of strays… with drones.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "History of the Roller Skate"
programme.desc: Take a ride through the history of the roller skate, explore the ancient art of baking, and find out more about the versatile Bamboo plant and it’s many uses’ from medicine to musical instruments.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "Chopsticks, Coffee and Coins"
programme.desc: Find our about chopsticks, coffee, coins, cooking and cotton, in this exciting episode that also explores the various Dinosaurs and what it’s like to feel and prepare for an Earthquake.

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "What do Karate, and Kick Boxing have in common?"
programme.sub-title: What do Karate, and Kick Boxing have in common?
programme.desc: Be more curious about the science of fossils and explore what’s on offer at the modern and popular gyms. What exactly is Induction Cooking and what do Karate, and Kick Boxing have in common?

programme.title: More Curious? S1 - "What is the Moon made of?"
programme.sub-title: What is the Moon made of?
programme.desc: What is milk? What is the Moon made of? How are Pencil’s made? Plus Roller Coasters, Rulers, Sail Boats, Snakes and more in this episode of More Curious.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "The Art of Shadowgraphy"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, the lights are off and the spotlight is on the art of shadowgraphy. Next up we’ll explore some card tricks and more optical illusions. Then feature rethinker performer Félicien Treway.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Is moving pictures an illusion?"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, take a look at the shades of colour, explore the Body transfer illusion, Liars paradox and video. Is moving pictures an illusion?

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Is a telescope a time machine?"
programme.sub-title: Is a telescope a time machine?
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, we explore tricks using sleight of hand. Play games with a water bottle, take a look at the Dunning Kruger effect and answer the question; Is a telescope a time machine?

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "The Leidenfrost Effect"
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, let’s play games with colour changing milk. Learn about chroma keys in video editing and do some mental math gymnastics. We’ll also explore the Leidenfrost effect and take a look at rethinker Linwood G Dunn.

programme.title: Science of Thrills S1 - "Speed"
programme.desc: Engineer and adventurer Rob Bell climbs aboard some of the world’s fastest theme park rides and learns what it takes to build them.

programme.title: Science of Thrills S1 - "Falling"
programme.desc: Engineer and adventurer Rob Bell discovers how our fear of falling is exploited by some of the world’s top theme park rides.

programme.title: Science of Thrills S1 - "Height"
programme.desc: Engineer and adventurer Rob Bell climbs aboard four spectacular rollercoasters in Europe and America that exploit our fear of heights.

programme.title: Science of Thrills S1 - "Inversion"
programme.desc: Engineer and adventurer Rob Bell investigates four roller coasters in Europe and America that use inversions, or loops, to create thrilling rides.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Noah's Ark for the Humans"
programme.desc: Scientists believe that within a few decades many useful microbes will have disappeared so they want to create a vault for Human Microbiota.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Drones in Space: Mars to Titan"
programme.sub-title: Drones in Space: Mars to Titan
programme.desc: Droves have already conquered Earth, and now they're heading out into the solar system. The Mars Helicopter, Ingenuity is proving to be successful and will pave the way for Dragonfly, a future daring mission to Titan.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "First Human Ink"
programme.desc: 65 million years ago, an immense space rock slammed into Earth, creating the equivalent of nuclear winter, killing all of the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Super Spider Silk"
programme.desc: From their unique predatory behaviors to the web masterpieces they weave, science is revealing big breakthroughs about spiders and their super strong and flexible silks.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "Terry's Lethal Weapon"
programme.desc: Can a Surfboard act as a projectile going through a car windshield and killing the bad guy?Can a 9mm bullet go through a bulldozer bucket to stop the driver?And will a AK47 be able to fire under water?

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "Jean Claude Van Schappert"
programme.desc: Terry enters the world of Slow-Mo and explosions trying to imitate Jean Claude in Hart Target. Terry and Larry will be testing 5 scenes from the Hard Target films. One of which will make you never look through a peep hole again!

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "S-Mart Terry"
programme.desc: Give me some sugar baby! Terry travels through time where he will test the cult favorite, Army of Darkness. Terry not only gets to test several scenes, but also gets a sit down with the legendary Bruce Campbell.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S5 - "Terry's Brave Heart"
programme.desc: Terry gets to annoy Larry with his impersonation of William Wallace from Braveheart. He not only gets to wield Sir Wallace's sword, but also convinces Larry to build him a Trebuchet.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Space Bots"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli shows us robots that are leading the way, both to Mars, and other destinations in the future.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Space Shuttle Documentary"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli speaks with five astronauts who ventured into space aboard this amazing and complex spacecraft.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Dealers on a Mission"
programme.desc: Larry takes on an impossible mission: he’s been asked to find an item worn in space by Apollo 15 legend Al Worden. Torie searches for Russian space items for a museum in San Francisco and Cole goes on the hunt for an item from Apollo 13.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Money Trouble"
programme.desc: Larry gets the offer of a lifetime: a Soviet era space suit. Torie pays big for an Apollo 11 artefact but it’s not what it seems. Cole meets Apollo 7 legend Walt Cunningham.
